post.author: Chuck
post.title: First Post
post.content:
This blog will be a place to document my work on the PugBuddy project, it's core Netduino Plus microcontroller, and whatever failures or successes may happen along the way.  The goal of the project will be to use the .NET Micro Framework and a plentiful supply of old rc cars and electronic toys that i've destroyed over the years to produce a new device capable of entertaining (or teasing) my pug dogs while i'm at work.  The 4 main things that i would like to achieve in v1 are:

  1. The device will respond to requests over TCP/IP by acting as a mobile web server.
  2. Control will be available through a simple web user interface.  Functions will include forward, backwards, left turn, right turn, and bone deploy.
  3. An onboard camera to deliver images to the web user.
  4. The device will be slobber resistant as one of my pugs has drooling issues...
